content.body:
> <@ljharb:matrix.org> `{ length: 0 }` needs to match an empty string, for example

We don't do type coerce, but do we need to do primitive boxing?
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @ljharb:matrix.org
{ length: 0 } needs to match an empty string, for example
We don't do type coerce, but do we need to do primitive boxing?

content.body: i mean, we could decide not to. but that would be a radical departure from the rest of the language.
if you can do `x.length` on it, and you can do `const { length } = x` on it, you should be able to `{ length }` pattern match on it
content.formatted_body: if you can do x.length on it, and you can do const { length } = x on it, you should be able to { length } pattern match on it

content.body: so i think "consistency with destructuring" forces us to do boxing, full stop
